strong.span:
The April 2020 School Board Meeting will be held via Zoom Webinars. Use the following link to attend the meeting on Tuesday, April 21, 2020 at 7:30 pm.
https://us02web.zoom.us/j/83947758042
Extended Elearning Announcemant and Calendar
Technology Information During Extended Elearning
strong.br:
Meals will be offered Monday - Friday. Meals are considered "essential" and will continue as planned.
Meals will be available 11 - 1. Meals will be served at or near each buildings main entrance. Students may receive meals at any of the following locations.
Pleasant Lake Elementary
Carlin Park Elementary
Hendry Park Elementary
Angola Middle School
Meals are provided free to any child ages 1 - 18. Meals will be served cold and includes breakfast and lunch. Meals on Friday will contain 3 each breakfast and lunch.
Meals will continue to be served during school closure due to the coronavirus.
“INSPIRING TOMORROW’S LEADERS”

br.br:
The Metropolitan School District of Steuben County in partnership with our families and community provides all learners with challenging, engaging, and innovative educational experiences that inspire them to be tomorrow's leaders.
We Believe That...
All individuals learn differently and can achieve at high levels.
All individuals require multiple opportunities to find success in a safe and positive learning environment.
All stakeholders have a role in how children develop and learn.
All individuals are responsible for improving the quality of life for self and others.
All individuals can excel.

br.span: It the policy of the Metropolitan School District of Steuben County to provide equal educational and employment opportunities regardless of race, creed, color, religion, national origin, age, gender, and where applicable marital status, familial status, parental status, domicile, disability, genetic information and medical testing, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender expression, political beliefs, reprisal, or any legally protected characteristic. We prohibit retaliation against anyone who brings forth any complaint.

br.br: For inquires of the: Title IX Coordinator, Section 504 Coordinator, and Americans With Disabilities Act (ADA). Contact the Director of Curriculum and Instruction.

hr.br:
The Metropolitan School District of Steuben County is a progressive district. Committed to excellence, our schools have received local, state, and national recognition for achievement. All of our schools are accredited through AdvancED focusing on continuous improvement. Our current school district enrolment is 2,737 students in grades K-12. We are a G Suite for Education District, and we are 1:1 with Chromebooks at all grade levels. Our district employs 198 certified and 212 classified staff to instruct and serve our students.
Our public school system offers a well-rounded academic and technical curriculum for all students from kindergarten through 12th grade. In addition to the regular curriculum, special programs for the academically and intellectually talented and the vocationally motivated students are available. The high school offers many dual credit options on and off campus. The MSD of Steuben County is a member of the Northeastern Indiana Special Education Cooperative that provides for the special needs of students with various disabilities. The district is a partner with Impact Institute, providing courses for students who will select careers in technical fields. The Educational Opportunity Center is an alternative education program provided for high school students who need an unconventional setting to complete graduation requirements.
Please visit our school sites and the Academics link for more details on programming, curriculum, and assessment practices.
The M.S.D. of Steuben County offers athletic activities for boys and girls as well as extra-curricular activities and programs. From basketball to wrestling, from music to drama, numerous programs are available for all students. We believe athletic and extracurricular programs are necessary to help students develop academically, physically, and socially.
Guidance and counseling services are provided for students at each of the six schools. After school child care is offered for students in kindergarten through sixth grade. In addition, health and social services are available to all students.
Our teachers and instructional assistants meet all requirements for Indiana teacher licensure and ESSA. In compliance with Title I Part A, this notification is to inform you that you may request information regarding the professional qualifications of your child’s classroom teacher or the professional qualifications of any paraprofessional that may provide educational services for your child. This information may be obtained by contacting the Title I Program Coordinator at the MSD of Steuben County Central Office at 260-665-2854, Extension 1311.
Link to the site below for our annual district and school performance reports that provide additional information.
Annual Performance Report
Accountability Data
Our Community
The Metropolitan School District of Steuben County is situated in the northeastern corner of Indiana, minutes away from Michigan to the north and Ohio to the east. Steuben County has 105 lakes that provide both summer and winter recreational opportunities. Lake James, the second largest natural lake in the state, is only five miles from Angola. Trine University, located in Angola, provides opportunities for educational opportunities as well as cultural and athletic events. Two major highways pass through Steuben County, providing direct access to Chicago, Detroit, Toledo, and Indianapolis.
Visit the official web site of Steuben County.

div.div:
Welcome to the Metropolitan School District of Steuben County. I appreciate your interest in our school corporation and hope that you find the information contained in this website to be helpful. Steuben County is a great place to live, work, and raise a family. Located in the middle of the county, you will find that M.S.D. of Steuben County offers an outstanding education to each and every child that it serves. Our mission is to provide a comprehensive quality educational program enabling students to become successful lifelong learners and contributors to society.
Our school district consists of four elementary buildings, a middle school, a high school, and an alternative school. Each school offers a challenging curriculum that is aligned with national, state, and district standards. Our comprehensive programs support exploration, creativity, and individual development while offering instructional support for every student. M.S.D. of Steuben County also provides excellent opportunities for our students to participate in performing arts, academic competitions, student organizations, athletics, and numerous other activities.
We believe that a nurturing and caring environment enhances a student’s self-confidence and contributes to his/her success. Our quality team of outstanding educators, support staff, administrators, and school board members are committed to providing the best learning opportunities possible for our students, but their hard work and dedication are only a part of the equation. It takes the support and involvement of parents for their children to reach their full potential. Together, as a team, we will deliver the quality education that our students need to be successful.
Thank you for visiting our website. Please don’t hesitate to contact us if you have any questions or if you want to receive additional information about our school district.
Sincerely,
Brent A. Wilson, Ph. D. Superintendent

br.br:
Report Bullying Forms
These forms may be sent via email to the school principal or counselor or mailed to their attention at the school building address below.
Indiana Department of Education Bullying & Cyberbullying Prevention & Response Web Page
Sexual Harassment

5022 Prohibition Against Sexual Harassment Student
Report of Sexual Harassment
